lines.text: [after listening to a scientist's theory on the radio]

[trying the lotion]
That feels great... very soothing.
I don't think you'll ever use anything else.
I tell you, Layton, expecting a bat to be attracted by the scent of a lotion is all foolishness.
You're a dreamer, Doc. Too much money is bad for dreamers.
So you tried to pay me in flattery, telling me that I'm a dreamer. Well... I *do* dream - dreams that you would *never* guess.
Say, have you ever had a date with a girl?
A girl? Oh, yes, a girl. I believe I did take a girl out once.
Now, rub it on the tender part of your neck.

[to Dr. Paul Carruthers]
Not so funny when it's your own jugular vein that's in danger. Is it, doc?
I'm not feeling too hot, would you take my temperature?
Oh yeah? Well you should see my tongue, it looks just like a squirrel's tail!
